microprocessor_definition.description: Track which display is current in an MFD chain

node.description: The input signal to be processed.

node.label: Output
node.description: The input signal to be processed.

object.script:
function gn(n) return input.getNumber(n) end
function gb(n) return input.getBool(n) end
function sb(n,v) output.setBool(n,v) end
function sn(n,v) output.setNumber(n,v) end
function onTick()
local newscr=0 local scr=gn(32)
if gb(3) then newscr=1 else if gb(4) then newscr=2 else if scr < 0.5 then newscr=1 end end end
local haznew = newscr >= 0.5 sb(32,haznew)
if haznew then sn(32,newscr) else sn(32,scr) end
-- It's kind of annoying this isn't done by default. The other blocks do it. for i = 1,31,1 do sn(i, gn(i)) sb(i, gb(i)) end end
function onDraw() end

object.script:
function gn(n) return input.getNumber(n) end
function onTick() throttle=gn(1) * 100 vectoring=gn(2) * 100 end
function onDraw()
w=screen.getWidth() h=screen.getHeight()
screen.setColor(0,0,0) screen.drawClear()
local txt = string.format("THROT\n%.0f\n\nVECTOR\n%.0f",throttle,vectoring) screen.setColor(0,255,0) screen.drawTextBox(0,0,w,h, txt) end

object.script:
function gn(i) return input.getNumber(i) end
function gb(i) return input.getBool(i) end
function onTick() heading=(-gn(1) * 360 + 360) % 360 velocity=gn(2) altitude=gn(3) gpsx=gn(4) gpsy=gn(5) fuel=gn(6) battery=gn(7) reserve_batt=gn(8) eng_rpm=gn(9) eng_temp=gn(10) throttle=gn(11) -- Throttle lever is scaled to the RPM range, 0-11000, with 12k being kaboom
end
function onDraw() w = screen.getWidth() h = screen.getHeight() lm = 4 -- Left margin because about one character's worth is obscured by the window frame
local str str = string.format("HDG: %3.0f
ALT: %.0f
GPS: %.0f
 %.0f
FUEL:%.0fL
" .. "PWR: %.0f
RPM: %.0f
TEMP: %.0f
BAT:
 %.0f (%.0f)", heading, altitude, gpsx, gpsy,fuel,throttle,eng_rpm,eng_temp,battery,reserve_batt) screen.setColor(0,0,0) screen.drawClear() screen.setColor(0,255,0) screen.drawTextBox(lm,0,w,h,str) end

object.script:
function gn(n) return input.getNumber(n) end
function sb(n,v) output.setBool(n,v) end
function gb(n) return input.getBool(n) end
function sn(n,v) output.setNumber(n,v) end
function clamp(n, low, high) return math.min(math.max(n, low), high) end
zoomq=5
function onTick()
scr=gn(32) -- These don't get passed forward by default sn(32,scr) sb(32,gb(32))
enabled=gb(3) if not enabled then return end gpsx=gn(1) gpsy=gn(2) hdg=(gn(3)*-360) % 360 waypointx=gn(4) waypointy=gn(5) zoomout=gb(1) zoomin=gb(2)
if zoomin then zoom=zoom-zoomq else if zoomout then zoom=zoom+zoomq end end
zoom=clamp(math.modf(zoom/zoomq)*zoomq,1,50) halfkm=zoom*500 end
zoom=1
function onDraw()
-- debug -- screen.setColor(255,255,255) -- screen.drawText(0,0,string.format("%.0f",scr))
if not enabled then return end cx=screen.getWidth()/2 cy=screen.getHeight()/2
screen.setColor(0,0,0) screen.drawClear()
screen.drawMap(gpsx,gpsy,zoom)
-- Draw self blip in center of map screen.setColor(255,0,0) screen.drawCircleF(cx,cy,2)
-- Draw waypoint blip screen.setColor(0,0,255)
local dx=waypointx-gpsx local dy=gpsy-waypointy
screen.drawCircleF(cx + dx * cx / halfkm, cy + dy * cy / halfkm, 2)
screen.setColor(0,0,255) local txt = string.format("%.0f\n%.0f\n%.0fkm",gpsx,gpsy,zoom) screen.drawText(0,0,txt) end

function gn(n) return input.getNumber(n) end
function sn(n,v) output.setNumber(n,v) end
function gb(n) return input.getBool(n) end
function onTick() gpsx=gn(1) gpsy=gn(2) wpx=gn(4) wpy=gn(5)
local dx=wpx-gpsx local dy=wpy-gpsy range=math.sqrt( dx^2 + dy^2 )
local b=(math.pi/2) - math.atan(dy,dx) b=(b+(math.pi*2)) % (math.pi*2) bearing=b*180/math.pi
sn(1,bearing) sn(2,range) end
function onDraw() local msg msg = string.format( "BRNG\n%.0f\n\nRANGE\n%.0f", bearing, range) screen.setColor(0,255,0) screen.drawText(0,0,msg) end

node.label: Ordnance FOV

object.script:
function gn(n) return input.getNumber(n) end
function gb(n) return input.getBool(n) end
function clamp(x,l,h) return math.max(l, math.min(x,h)) end
ord_fovh=0 function onTick() heading=-gn(1) * 360 heading=(heading+360) % 360 velocity=gn(2) * 1.943 --meters to knots alt=gn(3) * 3.28 -- meters to feet cannon=gn(4) bearing=gn(5) -- Bearing to current nav waypoint ord_fovh=gn(6)/2 gyros=gb(1) radwarn=gb(2) end
function dl(x,y,z,w) screen.drawLine(x,y,z,w) end
function chevron(x,y,vecx,vecy,wings) local x2,y2 dl(x,y,x+vecx,y+vecy) dl(x,y,x-vecx,y+vecy) if wings then dl(x+vecx,y+vecy,x+vecx*1.5,y+vecy*0.25) dl(x-vecx,y+vecy,x-vecx*1.5,y+vecy*0.25) end end
function center_pip() chevron(cx,cy,2,2,true) end
-- Constant pixel w/h in SW charw=4 charh=6
-- Number of heading labels to fit in tape hdgct=5
-- Degrees between heading labels hdgint=10
-- derived constants local marg=charw*3 ldeg=(hdgct*hdgint-hdgint)/2 -- Degrees the left edge of the screen represents
-- A heading from 0-359 function normhdg(deg) return (deg+360)%360 end
-- Center justify function ct(x,y,txt) local adj=string.len(txt)*charw/2 screen.drawText(x-adj,y,txt) end
-- Right-justify function jr(y, txt) local x=w-(string.len(txt)+1)*charw screen.drawText(x,y,txt) end
headchevy=charh*2-4 bearchevy=charh*1.5-2 function heading_tape(hdg) local vw=w+marg+marg local labeldist=w / (hdgct-1) --label distance in pixels local pixpdeg=labeldist/hdgint local d=(hdg-vw/pixpdeg/2) local d2=hdgint - (d % hdgint) local x=d2*pixpdeg-marg d=d+d2
while(x<vw) do ct(x,0, string.format("%.0f",normhdg(d))) x=x+labeldist d=d+hdgint end
chevron(cx,headchevy,3,3,false)
local bd=(bearing-heading+540)%360-180 x=clamp(bd*pixpdeg+cx,2,w-2) chevron(x,bearchevy,-2,-2,false) end
function airspeed() local txt=string.format("%03.0f\nKIAS", velocity) screen.drawText(0,cy,txt) end
function altitude() local txt=string.format("%05.0f",alt) jr(cy,txt) jr(cy+charh,"FT") end
-- Dimmed or bright function oncolor(b) if b then screen.setColor(0,255,0) else screen.setColor(0,8,0) end end
-- Dimmed or red function alertcolor(b) if b then screen.setColor(255,0,0) else screen.setColor(0,8,0) end end
function indicators() local y=h-charh
-- Ordnance FOV ring if ord_fovh>0 then screen.setColor(0,32,0) screen.drawCircle(cx,cy,ord_fovh*math.max(w,h)/fov) end
oncolor(gyros) screen.drawText(0,y,"GYROS") alertcolor(radwarn) screen.drawText(w-8*charw, y,"RADARW") y=y-charh screen.setColor(0,255,0) screen.drawText(0,y,string.format("CAN %03.0f",cannon)) end
fov=0 function onDraw() fov=property.getNumber("Display FOV") w=screen.getWidth() h=screen.getHeight() cx=w/2 cy=h/2
screen.setColor(0,0,0) screen.drawClear() screen.setColor(0,255,0) center_pip() heading_tape(heading) airspeed() altitude() indicators() end

node.description: The input signal to be processed.

node.label: Ordnance trigger
node.description: The input signal to be processed.

node.label: Radar azimuth
node.description: The input signal to be processed.

node.label: Ordnance FOV out
node.description: The input signal to be processed.

object.script:
-- How long to remember a contact. The stock radars are probably supposed to do this given that they -- provide an age field, but stuff just blinks in and out instantly. contact_dwell=5
-- Clock rolls over here clock_roll=9999999
function gb(n) return input.getBool(n) end
function gn(n) return input.getNumber(n) end
function sb(n,v) output.setBool(n,v) end
function intcomp(x,y) return math.abs(x-y) < 0.5 end
-- range, azimuth, elevation,timestamp,which (source) contacts={count=0,array={}}
min_zoom = -1 zoom_count = -1 zoom = 1 last_touch1 = false lock=0 which=false
-- Treat floats as ints for comparison function intcomp(a,b) return math.abs(a-b) < 0.5 end
-- Calculate age of given timestamp function age(t) local d=clock-t
-- if true then return 0 end if d < 0 then return clock_roll - t + clock end return d end
-- Package up the contact list in an object function fetch_contacts(obj,src) local i, pos local entry
-- Clean out stale contacts for i=obj.count,1,-1 do entry=obj.array[i] if age(entry[4]) > contact_dwell then table.remove(obj.array, i) if intcomp(i,lock) then lock = 0 end if i < lock then lock = lock -1 end obj.count=obj.count-1 end end
local noo for i=1,8,1 do if( gb(i) ) then noo=obj.count+1 pos=i*4-3 obj.array[noo]={} obj.array[noo][1]=gn(pos) obj.array[noo][2]=gn(pos+1) obj.array[noo][3]=gn(pos+2) obj.array[noo][4]=clock obj.array[noo][5]=src
if have_locks and intcomp(lock, i) then lock = noo end obj.count=obj.count+1 end end return obj end
ord_range=0 ord_t=0 function onTick() enabled = gb(8) sb(8,enabled) if not enabled then return end -- If not enabled have_locks=gb(9) have_range=gb(11) if have_range then ord_range=gn(12) end lock=gn(4) clock=gn(28) which=not gb(9) -- True when fetching main radar, false when fetching from seeker head
if not which then ord_t=clock end fetch_contacts(contacts,which) if min_zoom == -1 then min_zoom = property.getNumber("Radar min zoom") end if zoom_count == -1 then zoom_count = property.getNumber("Radar zooms") end
zoom = gn(30) end
function radius(cx, cy) return math.min(cx,cy) - 1 end
function blip(cont, sc, cx, cy,red,gr,bl)
local r = radius(cx,cy) local t = cont[2] * math.pi * 2 local range = cont[1] local h = r * range / sc local x = cx + math.sin(t) * h local y = cy - math.cos(t) * h
local bright=(contact_dwell-age(cont[4]))/contact_dwell *.76 screen.setColor(0.24 + red*bright,0.24 +gr*bright,0.24+bl*bright) screen.drawCircleF(x,y, 1) end
function draw_contacts(conts,scale,lock) local i local r,g,b b=0
for i=1,conts.count do if conts.array[i][5] then blip(conts.array[i], scale, cx, cy,0,255,0) end end
-- Overdraw for i=1,conts.count do if not conts.array[i][5] then blip(conts.array[i], scale, cx, cy, 255,255,0) end end
if not intcomp(lock,0) then blip(conts.array[lock], scale, cx, cy, 255,0,0) end end
scale=0 function onDraw()
if not enabled then return end if scale == 0 then scale=property.getNumber("radar scale") end
w=screen.getWidth() h=screen.getHeight() cx=w/2 cy=h/2 r=radius(cx,cy) local scale2
if intcomp(zoom,1) then scale2 = min_zoom else scale2 = scale * zoom / zoom_count end
screen.setColor(0, 255, 0)
local fmt local tmp if scale2 < 1000 then fmt="%.0fm" tmp=scale2 else fmt="%.0fk" tmp = scale2 / 1000 end
screen.setColor(0,255,0) screen.drawTextBox(0,0, cx, cy, string.format(fmt, tmp))
-- Draw the ordnance range ring if active and it offers that datum if have_range and age(ord_t) < 1 then -- ord_range=2000 screen.setColor(0,16,0) screen.drawCircle(cx,cy,ord_range*r/scale2) end
draw_contacts(contacts,scale2,lock) end

function onTick() enabled = input.getBool(8) azimuth = input.getNumber(1) -- Radar azimuth relative to forward end
function radius(w, h) return math.min(w,h)/2 - 1 end
-- Draw function that will be executed when this script renders to a screen function onDraw()
-- Whether we are enabled is encoded into second contact-age if not enabled then return end
w = screen.getWidth() -- Get the screen's width and height h = screen.getHeight() cx = w/2 cy = h/2 screen.setColor(0, 255, 0) -- Set draw color to green local r=radius(w,h) screen.drawCircle(w / 2, h / 2, r) -- Draw a 30px radius circle in the center of the screen local az=azimuth+math.pi*2
-- There's not much rhyme or reason to when a contact is detected -- with respect to the radar orientation. It randomly sees the contact -- from all manner of positions, so we'll just dispense with the sweep indicator. -- Checked this again. It's totally chaotic. You can seee a contact pop up right when the sweep is over it -- and then you'll see some more pop in and out throughout the sweep's travel. -- screen.drawLine(cx,cy,cx + math.cos(az) * r, cy + math.sin(az) * r) end

microprocessor_definition.name: HOTAS breakout
microprocessor_definition.description: Needed to funnel all the HOTAS signals through a hard point, as for an ejection seat

microprocessor_definition.name: Logic offload
microprocessor_definition.description: Optionally offload the ordnance logic, shared and compact

node.label: Control in
node.description: The input signal to be processed.

node.label: Control out
node.description: The input signal to be processed.

node.description: The input signal to be processed.

node.label: Targeting out
node.description: The input signal to be processed.

node.label: Hardpoint power enable
node.description: The input signal to be processed.

object.script:
-- Giving each weapon its own MCU works great if it's going to be huge (medium size and up) -- This is a shared version of the logic so that it can be left out of the weapons for compactness -- It lacks the fine timing on the arming and tracking delays, but it doesn't seem necessary
inf=1/0
function gn(n) return input.getNumber(n) end
function sn(n,v) output.setNumber(n,v) end
function gb(n) return input.getBool(n) end
function sb(n,v) output.setBool(n,v) end
-- -- Ordnance telemetry protocol (output) -- We overlay some of the fields in the radar protocol -- These fields are optional and the booleans specify whether the piece of ordnance provides them -- Boolean 32: Reserved for Radar MCU use -- Boolean 9: Lock ordinal: If true, Numeric 4 contains the contact ordinal of the locked or targeted contact -- Boolean 10: FOV: If true, Number 8 contains the FOV of the weapon's sensors for drawing a targeting ring -- on the HUD -- Boolean 11 Range. Specify sensor range to draw a ring on the radar
-- Number 4: Ordinal of lock-on contact. In the case of stock missile radar heads, it's always the closest contact -- Number 8: FOV so that it can be displayed on the HUD -- Number 12: Weapon sensor/targeting range in meters
-- Protocol (input) -- Boolean 9: Enable the weapon's sensors (radar etc.) which should use the game's standard radar -- protocol to report contacts on the composite-out. -- Check gb(9) to see whether the pilot is scanning for a target.
enabled=false
function passthrough() for i=1,32,1 do sn(i,gn(i)) sb(i,gb(i)) end end
function handle_locks()
local range=inf local present local r local nearest=0 -- 0 is no-lock
-- Currently the only method for identifying a locked contact. Maybe more later. -- Find nearest for i=1,8,1 do present=gb(i) if present then r=gn(i*4-3) if r < range and r > 50 then -- Assume that anything inside 50m is self-detection range=r nearest=i end end end sn(4,nearest) end
function onTick()
enabled=property.getBool("Enable shared") passthrough() if not enabled then return end fov=property.getNumber("FOV") range=property.getNumber("Range") report_lock=property.getBool("Report lock") lock_nearest=property.getBool("Lock nearest")
sb(9,report_lock) -- Notify whether will report a target ordinal sb(10,fov>0) -- Notify whether will report sensor/radar FOV sb(11,range>0) -- Notify whether will provide sensor range if fov>0 then sn(8,fov) end if range>0 then sn(12,range) end
scan=gb(9) if not scan then return end if report_lock then handle_locks() end end
function onDraw() end

microprocessor_definition.name: Ejection seat onboard MCU
microprocessor_definition.description: Program in a delay to account for canopy opening. We fire regardless in the hope it will flop open, as can happen with damage.

node.label: Eject signal
node.description: We assume this is held high, as by a connector "Launched" signal

node.label: Launch
node.description: The input signal to be processed.

object.script:
inf=1/0
function gn(n) return input.getNumber(n) end
function sn(n,v) output.setNumber(n,v) end
function gb(n) return input.getBool(n) end
function sb(n,v) output.setBool(n,v) end
-- -- Ordnance telemetry protocol (output) -- We overlay some of the fields in the radar protocol -- These fields are optional and the booleans specify whether the piece of ordnance provides them -- Boolean 32: Reserved for Radar MCU use -- Boolean 9: Lock ordinal: If true, Numeric 4 contains the contact ordinal of the locked or targeted contact -- Boolean 10: FOV: If true, Number 8 contains the FOV of the weapon's sensors for drawing a targeting ring -- on the HUD -- Boolean 11 Range. Specify sensor range to draw a ring on the radar
-- Number 4: Ordinal of lock-on contact. In the case of stock missile radar heads, it's always the closest contact -- Number 8: FOV so that it can be displayed on the HUD -- Number 12: Weapon sensor/targeting range in meters
-- Protocol (input) -- Boolean 9: Enable the weapon's sensors (radar etc.) which should use the game's standard radar -- protocol to report contacts on the composite-out. -- Check gb(9) to see whether the pilot is scanning for a target.
function onTick()
local range=inf local nearest=0 local r local present
scan=gb(9)
if not scan then return end
for i=1,8,1 do present = gb(i) sb(i,present) if present then r=gn(i*4-3) if r < range and r > 100 then -- Assume that anything inside 100m is self-detection range=r nearest=i end end end
for i=1,32,1 do sn(i,gn(i)) end
sb(9,true) -- Notify we will report a target ordinal sb(10,true) -- Notify we will report sensor/radar FOV sb(11,true) -- Notify we will provide sensor range
sn(4,nearest) sn(8,20) -- Roughly 20 degrees sn(12,2000) -- 2km gives about a 20 degree X/Y FOV. Should match the radar head configuration. end
function onDraw() end

for i=1,32,1 do sn(i,gn(i)) end
sb(9,true) -- Notify we will report a target ordinal sb(10,true) -- Notify we will report sensor/radar FOV sb(11,true) -- Notify we will provide sensor range
